intro: Cuphea ligustrina var. rosmarinifolia, commonly known as the lavender mistflower, is a compact, herbaceous perennial native to Mexico. It features striking, lavender-pink bracts that resemble small flowers, giving it a unique ornamental appearance. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly fuzzy texture, and it produces tiny, tubular flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. This variety is prized for its vibrant color and ability to add visual interest to gardens throughout the growing season.
